column4: I want to go to Feisty, but I don't want to risk losing my Mac partition...
then back it up.  Feisty is not stable, your computer could explode
I would back it up, but I don't have an extra hd right now...I really need to buy one...

I wouldn't recommend upgrading to feisty if you have important data without backups.  Wait for Feisty to be released as stable in April.  I would still really recommend backups of some kind for your data, don't wait until you lose important data to decide to start keeping backups, trust me
ignore it
it's already installed
how do I use it then?
it's used everytime you use a gtk application.  It's responsible for the widgets (buttons, progress bars, etc...).  What are you trying to do?
do you just want to theme them?
I want to modify an engine. (sorry, my words aren't working tonight...)
I'm not sure I understand what you want to do.  You want to get source code, edit it, and compile it?  Or are you just trying to change the way things look?
I want to change the way things look, but I couldn't find a theme I liked
what are you compiling?
why?  Those are all packaged and in the repositories
yes, why do you want glib, pango, atk, and gtk+?
no, all you need is a text editor to customize themes.  See http://live.gnome.org/GnomeArt/Tutorials
I think I told you this before, but I'm not sure:  you usually just want to go to a site like gnome-look.org and use one of those
sorry, I got conflicting advice at #ubuntu-effects
go to the link I gave you
(the first one, not gnome-look)
thanks for being patient with me! i'm a ditz.
that's ok we were all there once
I found what made me think I needed gtk...
that's asking for the gtk development package.  libgtk2.0-dev probably
